meta.concept: Areas where stop losses cluster - prime targets for stop hunts
meta.importance: Understanding liquidity zones prevents getting stopped out

concept.definition: Levels where large amounts of stop loss orders accumulate
concept.why_targeted: Market makers need liquidity to fill large orders

swing_lows.description: Below recent swing lows by 3-8 points
swing_lows.reason: Retail traders place stops just below lows

swing_highs.description: Above recent swing highs by 3-8 points
swing_highs.reason: Short sellers place stops just above highs

stop_hunt.description: Quick spike through level to trigger stops
stop_hunt.timing: Often at London or NY open

liquidity_grab.description: Sweep stops to accumulate liquidity for real move

avoid_obvious_stops.rule: Place stops 5-10 points beyond obvious liquidity zones
avoid_obvious_stops.example: If swing low is 2615, put stop at 2605 not 2613

fade_liquidity_grab.setup: Price spikes through level, immediately reverses
fade_liquidity_grab.entry: When price closes back inside level

trade_after_sweep.setup: Stops swept, now real move begins
trade_after_sweep.note: Liquidity grab often precedes real move

london_open.note: Common time for stop hunts before real move

protection_strategies.structure_based: Use recent swing structure, not obvious levels
protection_strategies.wider_is_safer: Accept wider stop to avoid sweep
